abstract: The Supreme Court heard arguments in the case of four women who lost seniority credit for pension benefits when they took maternity leave from AT&T.
snippet: The Supreme Court heard arguments in the case of four women who lost seniority credit for pension benefits when they took maternity leave from AT&T.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The argument of an employment discrimination case at the Supreme Court on Wednesday was full of references to one of the court’s more controversial decisions in recent years  the 2007 ruling against Lilly M. Ledbetter.

headline.main: Justices Hear Bias Case on Maternity, Pensions and Timing
headline.print_headline: Justices Hear Bias Case on Maternity, Pensions and Timing
